ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè júʼ mé ne ńgɔɔn ngie nzẅìŋ pʉ̀a pie é ne ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô, é cʉa pe Jÿâŋ, á gíŋ ńne ńnuʼu pʉ̀a ntse é gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa pe Jÿâŋ.
en: When Jesus   learned that the Pharisees  # 4:1 Mk 7:3 had heard he was making  # 4:1 Mt 28:19–20 and baptizing more disciples than John  # 4:1 Mk 1:4

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńké ńgwaa gɔɔn púʼu, kwàʼ Yěsô zɔ těen ńnuʼu pʉ̀a ntse wɔ́, megàŋakwò pé zɔ̌ ne ńnuʼu wɔ́b.
en: (though Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disciples were),

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pafalísáyè jǔʼ, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅindê ńcʉ́me mánzsè lépiŋ né tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa.
en: he left Judea   and went again to Galilee.  # 4:3 Mt 17:22

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie à zyɛ́ʼ ye tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Samalîɛ.
en: He had to travel through Samaria;

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo pà Samalîɛ, gie mé tóŋ lê Sikaa, á gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe nkáʼ gẅie Yakwɔ̂b la náa mbwó míŋ we Yesyɛ̂b.
en: so he came to a town of Samaria called Sychar near the property   that Jacob  # 4:5 Ps 22:23; Mt 1:2; Lk 1:33 had given his son Joseph.  # 4:5 Gn 30:24; 33:19; 48:22; 49:22

ngiemboon: Ntse ntǔŋ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo lê ntse Yakwɔ̂b gwɔ́ jʉʼó. Yěsô gwaa kúu jʉʼó, tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ cʉ́ʼʉ ńkuʼu kuʼ, mbà à gǐŋ tà ńkʉ́a, ésẅɛ́ʼ ńnéŋe ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe ntse ŋwɛ́.
en: Jacob’s well   was there, and Jesus, worn out from his journey, sat down at the well. It was about noon.  # 4:6 Lit about the sixth hour

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě we Samalîɛ tó létúʼ ntse, Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ná ntse n nú.»
en: A woman of Samaria came to draw water.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà megàŋakwò Yěsô gʉ̌a tÿǒsoŋ léjú shúm léjÿó.
en: because his disciples had gone into town to buy food.

ngiemboon: Manzwě we Samalîɛ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Ɔɔ nyìŋ Yúndà, ḿbiŋe ńdúɔ ntse nǔ mbwó mèŋ manzwě we Samalîɛ lá?» À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu, á nue pà Yúndà pâ pà Samalîɛ lɔ́ɔn těen ńjúʼe wɔ́.
en: “How is it that you, a Jew,   ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan  # 4:9 Lk 9:52; Ac 1:8 woman? ” she asked him. For Jews do not associate with  # 4:9 Or do not share vessels with Samaritans.  # 4:9 Other mss omit For Jews do not associate with Samaritans.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ gwéʼe péʼe ńzsé fùʼ gie Ssé náa, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn né gù ngie: “Ná ntse n nú”, mbà gù zɔ cʉ̌ʼ ńdúɔ ntse nǔ mbwó yé, á náa gú ntse gẅie éfóo lesaʼá.»
en: Jesus answered, “If you knew the gift of God,    and who is saying to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would ask him, and he would give you living water.”   # 4:10 Gn 26:19; Ps 36:7–9; Is 49:10; 55:1; Jr 2:13; Zch 14:8; Jn 7:38; Rv 7:17; 21:6; 22:1,17

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ zɔɔn fó te loŋngáa gẅiin, ntse piŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ssé tɛʼ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, wɛ̌ ntse gẅie éfóo lesaʼá piŋ fó pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: “Sir,”   said the woman, “you don’t even have a bucket, and the well is deep. So where do you get this ‘living water’?

ngiemboon: Tsye ɔ̀ cʉa mángʉanjʉʼ weg Yakwɔ̂b gẅie à la ná wɔɔn ntse ntǔŋ né peg ka? Ńgwaa ná, ńzɔɔn ńnú yé, penkʉ́ pé pâ menɔ̀ɔn gíŋ ńnú yɔ́b.»
en: You aren’t greater than our father Jacob,   are you? He gave us the well and drank from it himself, as did his sons and livestock.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńnú wɛ̂ ŋwɛ́, agág yé ké ńgíŋ éshÿó shÿó.
en: Jesus said, “Everyone who drinks from this water will get thirsty again.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ nú ntse gẅie mèŋ zɔ nǎa mbwó yé, mbà gág yé téen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe shÿó wɔ́. Mbà ntse ŋwɛ́ ge kúu mbùm yé, é cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lesaʼá ntse, á jʉʼ gie ntse ge ne fóo wó é cwoŋo, é náa legwɔ́ temì né yé.»
en: But whoever drinks from the water that I will give him will never get thirsty again.    In fact, the water I will give him will become a well   # 4:14 Or spring,# 4:14 Jms 3:11 of water springing up in him for eternal life.”   # 4:14 Jn 12:25; Ac 13:48; Rm 8:2; 1Jn 2:25

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ná wɛ̌ ntse ŋwɛ́ né mèŋ, agág yɔ́ɔn le láʼ ńgíŋ shÿó wɔ́. Ń de gíŋ ńtóo jʉʼɔɔn ńtúʼ ntse wɔ́.»
en: “Sir,” the woman said to him, “give me this water so that I won’t get thirsty and come here to draw water.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Gʉa ńtóŋo ndúm ɔ̀ pi yé tó.»
en: “Go call your husband,” he told her, “and come back here.”

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «N te ndúm gẅiin.» Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ gÿǒ mboŋó légɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ te ndúm gẅiin.
en: “I don’t have a husband,” she answered.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lǎ gẅiin tà é gwɔ́ méntʉ̂a, tá nyìŋ gẅie pi yé neŋé fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, à te ndúm ɔ̀ wɔ́. Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pɛ́ʼɛ̀ á kẅɛ.»
en: “For you’ve had five husbands, and the man you now have is not your husband. What you have said is true.”

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n gyǎ ngie ɔɔ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: “Sir,” the woman replied, “I see that you are a prophet.

ngiemboon: Ngie mbà, pamángʉanjʉʼ pég lɔ́ɔn ńguʼte Ssé ndùm lekwɛ́ sɔɔn, pi pà Yúndà, pi ee ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie ajʉʼʉ léguʼte Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ Yelúzálèm pɛ́ʼɛ̀ mè júʼu ye wɔ́?»
en: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain,   but you Jews say that the place to worship is in Jerusalem.”  # 4:20 Mt 23:37

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mɔ̌ɔn, zẅíŋe nò gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn. Afʉ̀ʼ ne ńkuʼu páʼ pi te gíŋ guʼte Tá á ndùm sɔɔn lekwɛ́, mbɔɔ Yelúzálèm wɔ́.
en: Jesus told her, “Believe me, woman, an hour is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pi guʼte Ssé té zsé mmó gie pi gÿo yɛ̌. Peg pà Yúndà peg gwaa guʼte Ssé, ńne ńzsé mmó gie peg gÿo yɛ̌, mélàʼmie Ssé cʉa na pà Yúndà tá ńgÿo pʉ̀a tsẅɛ́.
en: You Samaritans worship what you do not know. We worship what we do know, because salvation is from the Jews.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, afʉ̀ʼ ne ńkuʼu, tà á fǒ ńzɔɔn ńkuʼ kuʼ, páʼ kwàʼ paguʼte Ssé ge gwaa guʼte yé Ssé Tá, é zẅíʼte ncwò Zẅìge yé, tá guʼte yé na ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te. Ńtí nue yɛ̌ ntí paguʼte Ssé, ée pie é Ssé Tá ne ńkwoŋo.
en: But an hour is coming, and is now here,    when the true worshipers will worship the Father in Spirit and in truth.   # 4:23 Or in spirit and truth, also in v. 24 Yes, the Father wants such people to worship him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gwɔ̌ pɔ́ zẅìge, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pʉ̀a pie é guʼte yé, e gwaa guʼte yé, ńzẅíʼte ncwò Zẅìge yé tá ńguʼte yé na ntí gie á ne ńzɛ́te.»
en: God is spirit,    and those who worship him must worship in Spirit and in truth.”   # 4:24 2Th 2:10

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N zsě ngie Nzàʼnkÿo gẅie mé tóŋo lê Keleto ne ńtóo. À ge tó, é pú kyagte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, éshwóŋo wég.»
en: The woman said to him, “I know that the Messiah   is coming” (who is called Christ  # 4:25 Ex 29:29; Jn 1:41). “When he comes, he will explain everything to us.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mèŋ gẅie pɔ̀gɔ shwóŋe lɔɔn, n gee yé.»
en: Jesus told her, “I, the one speaking to you, am he.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn púʼu, megàŋakwò pé tó, ńgyá pɔ́ manzwě ne shwóŋe, á pú ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b tɛʼ. Táʼ, atsɔ́ wɔb ké te kuʼu lézɛ́te yé ngie: «Áa nò kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, kà légɔɔn ngie pɔ́ yé shwóŋo kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ wɔ́?»
en: Just then his disciples arrived, and they were amazed that he was talking with a woman. Yet no one said, “What do you want? ” or “Why are you talking with her? ”

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ nyé tÿóon ntse yé jʉʼó, ḿbiŋe tÿǒsoŋ, ńgɔɔn né láʼ ngie:
en: Then the woman left her water jar, went into town, and told the people,

ngiemboon: «Pi tó ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à shwoŋó wɔ́ɔn menò ntsèm mie n da gÿǒ. Tà à te gwɔ́ pɔ́ Nzàʼnkÿo wɔ́ɔ?»
en: “Come, see a man who told me everything I ever did. Could this be the Messiah? ”

ngiemboon: Aláʼ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńtó né lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: They left the town and made their way to him.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa tó púʼu, megàŋakwò pé ne ńtsíŋe yé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Labi, pfɛ́ɛ mémmó la!»
en: In the meantime the disciples kept urging him, “Rabbi,   eat something.”

ngiemboon: Tá á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «N gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó léjÿó gie n gee ńjÿó, á gwɔ́ gie pi te ne ńzsé wɔ́.»
en: But he said, “I have food to eat that you don’t know about.”

ngiemboon: Megàŋakwò pé júʼ púʼu, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉ̌ʼ ńdɔgɔ mmó léjÿó ńtó, ńná né yé keen?»
en: The disciples said to one another, “Could someone have brought him something to eat? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ayɔ́ɔn mmó léjÿó gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie nyìŋ gẅie à ka túmo wɔ́ɔn à ne ńkwoŋo, mbɔɔ lémege fàʼ gie à ka nǎ né mèŋ.
en: “My food is to do the will of him    who sent me   # 4:34 Jn 5:30 and to finish his work,”   # 4:34 Jn 5:36 Jesus told them.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ ee těen ńgɔɔn ngie: “É cʉ́ʼʉ ńzága mesaŋ lekùɔ, mé lag shúm wɔ́ le?” Táʼ, mèŋ, n ge shwóŋo gẅí yɔ́ɔn ngie pi pʉʼʉ twó gí, ńdíe tsẅɛ tá ńgyá, eshúm tʉ̌ tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńzɛ́te pɔ́ lélag.
en: “Don’t you say, ‘There are still four more months, and then comes the harvest’? Listen to what I’m telling you: Open    your eyes and look at the fields, because they are ready   # 4:35 Lit white for harvest.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à laga shúm, à ne ńkẅé pèen yé, é gwɔ́ páʼ à ne ńcúʼte mmó ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ legwɔ́ temì. Légwɔ́ gie ambyè mmó pɔ́ ndàga ge pú kág.
en: The reaper is already receiving pay and gathering fruit for eternal life,    so that the sower and reaper can rejoice together.

ngiemboon: Púʼu, esagánò gẅie é gɔɔn ngie: “Ambyè aa wó, andàga gwɔ́ wó, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́.”
en: For in this case the saying is true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’

ngiemboon: N ka túmo gẅí ńdag shúm sie pi ka te gyá tsɔ̌ ngɔ́ʼ mǒ ḿbye wɔ́, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a la gyá ngɔ́ʼ, pi ka tó gí, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ fàʼ yɔ́b zẅɛ̌ʼ.»
en: I sent you to reap what you didn’t labor for; others have labored, and you have benefited from    their labor.”

ngiemboon: Á la fó na shwóŋè manzwě ŋwɛ́ gie à la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «À shwoŋó wɔ́ɔn kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n dǎ gÿo. Epʉ̀a Samalîɛ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie é laa na yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, é záb ntʉ́m na Yěsô!»
en: Now many Samaritans   from that town believed in him because of what the woman said  # 4:39 Lit because of the woman’s word when she testified,  # 4:39 Jn 15:26; Ac 26:5 “He told me everything I ever did.”

ngiemboon: Ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie pâ pɔ̌ zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńnéŋe. Yěsô zẅíŋ, ńnéŋe jʉʼó lyɛ̌ʼ pʉ́a.
en: So when the Samaritans came to him,   they asked him to stay with them, and he stayed there two days.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gíŋ ńkẅiʼi ńzáb ntʉ́m na yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtíi shwóŋè yé.
en: Many more believed because of what he said.

ngiemboon: Ńne ńgɔɔn né manzwě ŋwɛ́ ngie: «Peg těen ńnyé ńzába ntʉ́m na Yěsô ńtí pɔ́ shwóŋè jú ndàʼ wɔ́, peg zába ntʉ́m na yé fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ńtíi páʼ peg yég cwoŋó ńjúʼu shwóŋè yé, tà ńzsé ngie aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo epʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, e tsẅɛ́.»
en: And they told the woman, “We no longer believe because of what you said, since we have heard for ourselves and know that this really is the Savior   of the world.”  # 4:42 Other mss add , the Messiah

ngiemboon: Elyɛ̌ʼ sépʉ́a sa gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, Yěsô fó jʉʼó, ńne ńgee né tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa.
en: After two days he left there for Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mbà Yěsô yé máŋwɛ́ la gɔɔn ngie: «Mé té ná mekùʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé láʼ pɔ́b wɔ́.»
en: (Jesus himself had testified   that a prophet has no honor in his own country.  # 4:44 Mt 13:57; Mk 6:4; Lk 4:24)

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa tà ńkúu Ngalílîa, epʉ̀a Ngalílîa kúe yé mboŋó. Á nue pɔ́ ka gʉa línɔ̀ɔn á Yelúzálèm, ńkúu wó, ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à ne ńgÿo.
en: When   they entered Galilee, the Galileans  # 4:45 Mt 26:69; Mk 14:70; Lk 13:1–2; 22:59; 23:6; Ac 1:11; 2:7; 5:37 welcomed him because they had seen everything he did in Jerusalem  # 4:45 Mt 23:37 during the festival.  # 4:45 Jn 2:23; 5:1 For they also had gone to the festival.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ tà ńkúu Kánà we Ngalílîa, á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie à la sele ntse wó, ńdɔg ńgÿo melùʼ. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndÿò na fàʼa ngúmnɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, míŋ we ne ńguɔ.
en: He went again to Cana   of Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. There was a certain royal official whose son was ill at Capernaum.  # 4:46 Lk 10:15

ngiemboon: Á júʼ ngie Yěsô fǒ Jẅindê ńtóo Ngalílîa, ńgʉa ńgyá yé, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à cwóŋo Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, ńgÿo míŋ we gẅie à cʉʼʉ́ ńkwé kwě, à zeŋe.
en: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea   into Galilee, he went to him and pleaded with him to come down and heal his son, since he was about to die.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Pi lɔɔn te gyá menò mɔɔnmɔɔn mie é laʼte metʉ̀ Ssé pâ menkʉ̀ʼʉ menò wɔ́, pi le láʼ ńzáb ntʉ́m na mèŋ wɔ́.»
en: Jesus told him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders,    you will not believe.”   # 4:48 Jn 3:16; 6:64; 20:25

ngiemboon: Ngàŋafàʼ ngúmnɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Tsetsɔ́ʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, cwóŋo ńgyá míŋ wɔ̀ɔn tá à kwé.»
en: “Sir,”   the official said to him, “come down before my boy dies.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gʉa! Míŋ gù zeŋé.» Wɔɔn ndÿò zẅíŋe nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn né yé, ńgʉa.
en: “Go,” Jesus told him, “your son will live.” The man believed what   Jesus said to him and departed.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè ńne ńcwóŋo ńgee, megàŋafàʼ pé tó ńzáʼa yé, éshwóŋo yé ngie: «míŋ gù aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.»
en: While he was still going down, his servants met him saying that his boy was alive.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b fʉ̀ʼ gie à ka zeŋe, pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Á kaa mbÿɛ̀njÿó jǔɔ á na tàʼ nèm, ennɛ́ záʼa na yé.»
en: He asked them at what time he got better. “Yesterday at one in the afternoon   the fever left him,” they answered.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ júʼ, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ fʉ̀ʼ ŋwɛ́ gie Yěsô ka gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «Míŋ we zeŋe la.» Á leen ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m wé na Yěsô, pâ pʉ̀a pé metsèm ndá yé.
en: The father   realized this was the very hour at which Jesus had told him, “Your son will live.” So he himself believed, along with his whole household.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo yɔɔn nò mɔɔnmɔɔn, á fʉ̀ʼ gie à fǒ Jẅindê ḿbiŋ né Ngalílîa páʼɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nò mɔɔnmɔɔn mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gie à gÿǒ á Kánà.
en: Now this was also the second sign   Jesus performed after he came from Judea to Galilee.  # 4:54 Mt 17:22
